pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b202e7b62c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20235/commits/b202e7b62c76c483ce7b9ff0d81f399427aee8e0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (priority := 100) Countable.of_linearOrder_locallyFiniteOrder [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] :`
`+ instance (priority := 100) [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] [PredOrder ι] : IsPredArchimedean ι`
`+ instance (priority := 100) [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] [SuccOrder ι] : IsSuccArchimedean ι`
`+ predOrder`
`+ succOrder`
`- instance (priority := 100) [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] : IsPredArchimedean ι`
`- instance (priority := 100) [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] : IsSuccArchimedean ι`
`- instance (priority := 100) [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] : PredOrder ι`
`- instance (priority := 100) [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] : SuccOrder ι`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
variable {ι : Type*} [LinearOrder ι] [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] [OrderBot ι] [TopologicalSpace ι]
  [OrderTopology ι] [MeasurableSpace ι] [BorelSpace ι] [MeasurableSpace E] [BorelSpace E]
  [SecondCountableTopology E] {ℱ : Filtration ι m} {τ σ : Ω → ι} {f : ι → Ω → E} {i : ι}
```
@urkud Could you please explain why you now want the `OrderTopology` assumption, instead of `DiscreteTopology`?
I thought that I need them to state the theorems, but I was wrong. Reverted.
Since `succOrder` and `predOrder` contain data, shouldn't these be `let` (or `letI`) rather than `have`?
If the proof works, I think you are free to use `have`, which might reduce some burden for Lean.

It seems a pity to introduce code like this in files like `OptionalSampling` which are definitely far outside the API boundary of order theory. 

If I undestand correctly, these lines are needed in order to synthesize `OrderTopology ι`. But `OrderTopology` is Prop-valued, isn't it? It contains no data. So maybe we should have an instance somewhere much higher up (maybe `Mathlib.Topology.Order.Basic`?) along the lines of the following:
```
instance {ι : Type*} 
    [LinearOrder ι] [LocallyFiniteOrder ι] [TopologicalSpace ι] [DiscreteTopology ι] : 
    OrderTopology ι := 
  letI := LinearLocallyFiniteOrder.succOrder ι
  letI := LinearLocallyFiniteOrder.predOrder ι
  inferInstance
```
Then the existing code in `OptionalSampling` will "just work".

Can you find a good home for this instance? It depends on an instance in `Topology/Instances/Discrete` but that file doesn't know about `LocallyFiniteOrder`. Create a new file `Topology/Order/LocallyFiniteOrder`?

I think we should add this instance to `Topology/Instances/Discrete`. We would need to add `Order/SuccPred/LinearLocallyFinite` to the imports of that file, but it seems that would only mean a 2% import increase in that file.
(See #20261, which is a PR which I made solely in order to trigger the PR import-testing script, since it was easier than working out how to run the script locally.)
Looks good to me. @urkud Do you agree? If so, we can merge David's branch into this one.

pullRequest.title: chore(Order/SuccPred/LinearLocallyFinite): change data-creating instances to defs

source.title: feat(Order/PartialSups): allow general orders as domain
